segment.source: Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment
segment.target: Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment

segment.source: Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment
segment.target: Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment

segment.source: Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment
segment.target: Results for the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment

segment.source: Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment results show metrics and issues that highlight energy efficiency problems.
segment.target: Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment results show metrics and issues that highlight energy efficiency problems.

segment.source: Whenever possible, the cause of the energy efficiency problem is identified.
segment.target: Whenever possible, the cause of the energy efficiency problem is identified.

segment.source: For example, it could be drivers, processes, or services.
segment.target: For example, it could be drivers, processes, or services.

segment.source: Recommended solutions for these problems are provided.
segment.target: Recommended solutions for these problems are provided.

segment.source: This topic helps you interpret the results produced by a Battery life during connected standby job that uses the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment.
segment.target: This topic helps you interpret the results produced by a Battery life during connected standby job that uses the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment.

segment.source: It also provides guidance on how to use the results to identify and resolve common issues that negatively impact computer battery life.
segment.target: It also provides guidance on how to use the results to identify and resolve common issues that negatively impact computer battery life.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Goals File
segment.target: Goals File

segment.source: Metrics
segment.target: Metrics

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: For more information about energy efficiency-related jobs, see Connected Standby Energy Efficiency.
segment.target: For more information about energy efficiency-related jobs, see Connected Standby Energy Efficiency.

segment.source: Goals File
segment.target: Goals File

segment.source: You can create custom goals to measure your improvements in the Results View.
segment.target: You can create custom goals to measure your improvements in the Results View.

segment.source: Goals files are a triage tool that can help you understand how a PC is performing and to compare PCs in your business.
segment.target: Goals files are a triage tool that can help you understand how a PC is performing and to compare PCs in your business.

segment.source: For example, goals for a basic laptop might be different than the goals you set for a high end desktop computer, or market expectations might change in such a way that you want the flexibility to define different goals and key requirements as time passes and technology improves.
segment.target: For example, goals for a basic laptop might be different than the goals you set for a high end desktop computer, or market expectations might change in such a way that you want the flexibility to define different goals and key requirements as time passes and technology improves.

segment.source: When a metric value is compared to the goal for that metric, the status is color coded in the Result View as follows:
segment.target: When a metric value is compared to the goal for that metric, the status is color coded in the Result View as follows:

segment.source: Light purple means that the system has a great user experience and that there are no perceived problems.
segment.target: Light purple means that the system has a great user experience and that there are no perceived problems.

segment.source: Medium purple means that the user experience is tolerable and you can optimize the system.
segment.target: Medium purple means that the user experience is tolerable and you can optimize the system.

segment.source: Review the recommendations and analysis to see what improvements can be made to the system.
segment.target: Review the recommendations and analysis to see what improvements can be made to the system.

segment.source: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.
segment.target: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.

segment.source: Dark purple means that the system has a poor user experience and that there is significant room for improvements.
segment.target: Dark purple means that the system has a poor user experience and that there is significant room for improvements.

segment.source: Review the recommendations and analysis to see the improvements that can be made to the system.
segment.target: Review the recommendations and analysis to see the improvements that can be made to the system.

segment.source: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.
segment.target: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.

segment.source: You might have to consider making tradeoffs to deliver a high quality Windows experience.
segment.target: You might have to consider making tradeoffs to deliver a high quality Windows experience.

segment.source: No color means that there are no goals defined for the metric.
segment.target: No color means that there are no goals defined for the metric.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In the Windows Assessment Toolkit for Windows 8, some assessments include default goals files.
segment.target: In the Windows Assessment Toolkit for Windows 8, some assessments include default goals files.

segment.source: The first time you view results using this version of the tools, the default goals file is used.
segment.target: The first time you view results using this version of the tools, the default goals file is used.

segment.source: However, you can also define custom goals for Windows 8 the same way that you can for Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.
segment.target: However, you can also define custom goals for Windows 8 the same way that you can for Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.

segment.source: You can set the goals file location and add a goals file to that location before you can use the UI to apply the custom goals.
segment.target: You can set the goals file location and add a goals file to that location before you can use the UI to apply the custom goals.

segment.source: Once a goals file is selected it will continue to be the goals file that is used for any results that are opened.
segment.target: Once a goals file is selected it will continue to be the goals file that is used for any results that are opened.

segment.source: Only one goals file can be used at a time.
segment.target: Only one goals file can be used at a time.

segment.source: Goals for all assessments are set in a single goals file.
segment.target: Goals for all assessments are set in a single goals file.

segment.source: The assessment tools will search for goals in the following order:
segment.target: The assessment tools will search for goals in the following order:

segment.source: A custom goals file
segment.target: A custom goals file

segment.source: Goals that are defined in the results file
segment.target: Goals that are defined in the results file

segment.source: Goals that are defined in the assessment manifest
segment.target: Goals that are defined in the assessment manifest

segment.source: You can use the sample goals file that is provided at %PROGRAMFILES%Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitWindows Assessment ToolkitSDKSamplesGoals to create your own goals file.
segment.target: You can use the sample goals file that is provided at %PROGRAMFILES%Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitWindows Assessment ToolkitSDKSamplesGoals to create your own goals file.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot package a goals file with a job, but you can store it on a share for others to use.
segment.target: You cannot package a goals file with a job, but you can store it on a share for others to use.

segment.source: Metrics
segment.target: Metrics

segment.source: The following metrics are generated by the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment:
segment.target: The following metrics are generated by the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment:

segment.source: Time spent in DRIPS
segment.target: Time spent in DRIPS

segment.source: This metric represents the time that is spent in the Deepest Runtime Idle Power State (DRIPS) as a percentage of the time spent in resiliency.
segment.target: This metric represents the time that is spent in the Deepest Runtime Idle Power State (DRIPS) as a percentage of the time spent in resiliency.

segment.source: In Quiet Hours
segment.target: In Quiet Hours

segment.source: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that the system was in Quiet Hours during the assessment run.
segment.target: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that the system was in Quiet Hours during the assessment run.

segment.source: Quiet Hours reduce background activity during Connected Standby, which may affect the results.
segment.target: Quiet Hours reduce background activity during Connected Standby, which may affect the results.

segment.source: Resiliency/In Connected Standby
segment.target: Resiliency/In Connected Standby

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that is spent in resiliency, during which devices are opportunistically allowed to enter deeper idle states to conserve power.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that is spent in resiliency, during which devices are opportunistically allowed to enter deeper idle states to conserve power.

segment.source: Sub-metrics
segment.target: Sub-metrics

segment.source: Devices
segment.target: Devices

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that devices and components prevented the computer from entering DRIPS.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that devices and components prevented the computer from entering DRIPS.

segment.source: The devices sub-metric is further broken down into individual devices.
segment.target: The devices sub-metric is further broken down into individual devices.

segment.source: Each device is listed separately along with the total time that the device prevented the computer from entering DRIPS.
segment.target: Each device is listed separately along with the total time that the device prevented the computer from entering DRIPS.

segment.source: Activators
segment.target: Activators

segment.source: This set of metrics represents the time, in seconds, that an activator prevented the computer from entering DRIPS.
segment.target: This set of metrics represents the time, in seconds, that an activator prevented the computer from entering DRIPS.

segment.source: Each activator is represented as a separate metric.
segment.target: Each activator is represented as a separate metric.

segment.source: Some activators are further broken down into subtasks.
segment.target: Some activators are further broken down into subtasks.

segment.source: Activators that can prevent the computer from entering DRIPS are listed below:
segment.target: Activators that can prevent the computer from entering DRIPS are listed below:

segment.source: WNS (Windows Notification Services)
segment.target: WNS (Windows Notification Services)

segment.source: IDM (Image Download Manager)
segment.target: IDM (Image Download Manager)

segment.source: BI (Broker Infrastructure)
segment.target: BI (Broker Infrastructure)

segment.source: WU (Windows Update)
segment.target: WU (Windows Update)

segment.source: GP (Group Policy)
segment.target: GP (Group Policy)

segment.source: NCSI (Network Connectivity Status Indicator)
segment.target: NCSI (Network Connectivity Status Indicator)

segment.source: Toast Notifications
segment.target: Toast Notifications

segment.source: PLM (Process Lifetime Manager)
segment.target: PLM (Process Lifetime Manager)

segment.source: PDC internal activators
segment.target: PDC internal activators

segment.source: Resiliency phase not entered
segment.target: Resiliency phase not entered

segment.source: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that the computer was prevented from entering resiliency.
segment.target: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that the computer was prevented from entering resiliency.

segment.source: This metric is further broken down into time while entering Connected Standby and time while exiting Connected Standby.
segment.target: This metric is further broken down into time while entering Connected Standby and time while exiting Connected Standby.

segment.source: CPU Activity
segment.target: CPU Activity

segment.source: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that processors were active while the computer was in Connected Standby.
segment.target: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that processors were active while the computer was in Connected Standby.

segment.source: The CPU Activity sub-metric is further broken down into individual processes.
segment.target: The CPU Activity sub-metric is further broken down into individual processes.

segment.source: Each process is listed separately along with the total time that the process was active during Connected Standby.
segment.target: Each process is listed separately along with the total time that the process was active during Connected Standby.

segment.source: Enter/Exit Connected Standby
segment.target: Enter/Exit Connected Standby

segment.source: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that the computer spends entering and leaving Connected Standby.
segment.target: This metric represents the total time, in seconds, that the computer spends entering and leaving Connected Standby.

segment.source: Each phase is divided into six sub-phases.
segment.target: Each phase is divided into six sub-phases.

segment.source: Low-Power Phase
segment.target: Low-Power Phase

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Low-Power phase, during which callback notifications for entering and leaving the low-power state are sent to registered drivers and services that were not suspended during the PLM phase or the DAM phase.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Low-Power phase, during which callback notifications for entering and leaving the low-power state are sent to registered drivers and services that were not suspended during the PLM phase or the DAM phase.

segment.source: DAM Phase
segment.target: DAM Phase

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Desktop Activity Moderator (DAM) phase, during which the DAM suspends or resumes the execution of user-session desktop processes.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Desktop Activity Moderator (DAM) phase, during which the DAM suspends or resumes the execution of user-session desktop processes.

segment.source: PLM Phase
segment.target: PLM Phase

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Process Lifetime Manger (PLM) phase, during which the PLM suspends or resumes the execution of Windows Store apps.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Process Lifetime Manger (PLM) phase, during which the PLM suspends or resumes the execution of Windows Store apps.

segment.source: Resiliency Notification Phase
segment.target: Resiliency Notification Phase

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Resiliency Notification phase, during which the PDC sends power notification events indicating that it will transition to resiliency next.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Resiliency Notification phase, during which the PDC sends power notification events indicating that it will transition to resiliency next.

segment.source: Maintenance Phase
segment.target: Maintenance Phase

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Maintenance phase, during which underlying maintenance activities are run.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Maintenance phase, during which underlying maintenance activities are run.

segment.source: Connection Phase
segment.target: Connection Phase

segment.source: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Connection phase, during which Windows filters input and handles remote sessions.
segment.target: This metric represents the time, in seconds, that the computer spends in the Connection phase, during which Windows filters input and handles remote sessions.

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: The Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment performs advanced issue analysis and provides links to Windows® Performance Analyzer (WPA) to troubleshoot the issues that are identified.
segment.target: The Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment performs advanced issue analysis and provides links to Windows® Performance Analyzer (WPA) to troubleshoot the issues that are identified.

segment.source: WPA might present additional details about disk activity or CPU activity depending on the types of issues that were identified.
segment.target: WPA might present additional details about disk activity or CPU activity depending on the types of issues that were identified.

segment.source: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations see, Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.
segment.target: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations see, Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.

segment.source: % time in lowest C-State is 0 for ARM-based devices
segment.target: % time in lowest C-State is 0 for ARM-based devices

segment.source: When running the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment on an ARM-based device, the % time in lowest C-State metric is reported as 0.
segment.target: When running the Connected Standby energy efficiency assessment on an ARM-based device, the % time in lowest C-State metric is reported as 0.

segment.source: Data related to observed C-State values during the assessment run is available through the Idle States graph in Windows Performance Analyzer.
segment.target: Data related to observed C-State values during the assessment run is available through the Idle States graph in Windows Performance Analyzer.

segment.source: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006
segment.target: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006

segment.source: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.
segment.target: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.

segment.source: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.
segment.target: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.

segment.source: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:
segment.target: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:

segment.source: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.
segment.target: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.

segment.source: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:
segment.target: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:

segment.source: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
segment.target: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
